availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Dunlop Osborne (Louisville, Kentucky, newspaper editor and owner)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, newspaper editor. Virginia native. Married to Harriotte Graves Osborne in Mason County on October 9, 1851. Father of William J. E. Osborne, Emily G. Osborne, Mary Jane Osborne, Hattie Osborne, and Sallie Osborne. Editor of the Louisville Journal in 1860. President of the Western Associated Press in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, 5th Ward, p. 144-45.

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Mason County Marriages, Film #000819593, p. 56 of microfilm.
A. T. Andreas, History of Chicago: from the Earliest Period to the Present Time, v. II From 1857 Until the Fire of 1871 (Chicago: A. T. Andreas Company, 1885), 500.
